results.title: The Federal Republic of Germany and the Federal Lands
results.brief_description: A study of the Federal system of the German Republic (West Germany). Shows the responsibilities of the Government in Bonn as well as the governments of the ten states (Laender) which comprise the German Federation.

results.title: Federal highway
results.creator_credit: Michael Healy, British Road Federation and Richard Costain Film Unit
results.brief_description: A tour of West Germany to inspect the rapidly developing trunk road and urban motorway system. Through the Rhineland from Frankfurt to Cologne, then to Hamburg and Berlin, we see some of the road and bridge works. Aerial views of complex autobahn junctions and intersections which cannot be appreciated from the ground.

results.title: Fate of a child
results.creator_credit: Leo Seltzer and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: The death of a child is dramatised to show the living conditions in an under-developed area in Latin America. People surrounded by potential wealth live in poverty, starvation and ignorance. Technical assistance by the United Nations will help to eliminate the conditions responsible for the death of this child, through the economic development of such areas.

results.title: Farnborough looks forward (1957)
results.brief_description: A survey of the aeroplanes on exhibition at the 1957 Farnborough Air Show featuring some of the latest developments in British aircraft design. Missiles on display included the Thunderbird, Bloodhound, Sea Slug and Firestreak; new aircraft - the Fairy Delta 2 capable of reaching a speed of 1100 mph.

results.title: Farming with a difference
results.brief_description: The secret of successful farming is scientific management. At a demonstration farm at Hobbs Cross, visiting farmers come to garner the fruits of research. Hobbs Cross is shown to be a practical house of notions that farmers can adapt to their own needs and pockets.

results.title: Farewell to charms
results.creator_credit: Carla Pontiac, Carole Sklan and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experimental feminist film which questions the goals of love and romance as a woman’s ultimate fulfillment. Emma, vivacious but suicidal terrorist is reunited with Cecily, her old school chum. They meet a ‘bionic bike dyke’ called stretch and break open the jelly beans. Will they stretch a point over the pool table? Will tap-dancing and vaginal exercises be enough for Cecily? Will Emma metamorphose into Esther Williams? True romance. Cast includes Radda Jordan, Helen Pankhurst.

results.title: Farewell Oak Street
results.creator_credit: Grant McLean, Gordon Burwash and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of what a low-rental housing project can mean to the people who once shared aged, sub-standard dwellings. A before-and-after picture about people in a large-scale public housing project in Toronto, who, because of the housing shortage, had been forced to live in squalid, dingy flats, all-purpose rooms, and ramshackle houses on a crowded street in Regent Park North. These people were freed through housing development to inhabit new, modern dwellings planned to give a measure of privacy, light and air.

results.title: The Family: life styles of the future (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Beryl Fox, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel, Document Associates and Hobel-Leiterman Productions
results.brief_description: Dr. Margaret Meade, considers the concept of the family. Whilst the nuclear family has predominated in industrial societies, Dr. Meade highlights current developments, including the communal family and the “three-way marriage”. She then progresses into a discussion on the factors that will influence the composition of the family of the future.
